extendedIngredients.name: cayenne pepper
extendedIngredients.original: 1/8 tsp chipotle powder or cayenne pepper, your choice (chipotle will add smoky heat; cayenne just heat)

title: Smoky Pepper Shrimp
summary: You can never have too many main course recipes, so give Smoky Pepper Shrimp a try. For $2.85 per serving, this recipe covers 17% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe makes 1 servings with 148 calories, 26g of protein, and 2g of fat each. It is a good option if you're following a caveman, gluten free, dairy free, and primal diet. Head to the store and pick up shrimp, salt, ground szechuan pepper, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the ginger you could follow this main course with the Ginger Cake with Crystallized Ginger Frosting as a dessert. 1 person were glad they tried this recipe. With a spoonacular score of 55%, this dish is good. Similar recipes include Smoky Red Pepper Dip, Smoky Red Pepper Soup, and Smoky Red Pepper Soup.

winePairing.pairingText: Shrimp on the menu? Try pairing with Pinot Grigio, Riesling, and Sauvignon Blanc. These crisp white wines work well with shrimp prepared in a variety of ways, whether grilled, fried, or in garlic sauce. The Santi Sortesele Pinot Grigio with a 4.4 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 17 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Santi Sortesele Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: Straw yellow hue, accompanied by a close-focused nose of pear, apricot and white flowers. The fruity palate, with top notes of stone fruit, shows ripeness and roundness well supported by an elegant acidity and savoriness, ensuring a long, lingering finish.

instructions: Heat oil in a pan on medium-high. Combine the spices and toss with the shrimp.  Add shrimp to the hot pan and cook about 45 seconds per side, or until opaque. Remove the shrimp.  Add the scallions, garlic and ginger to the pan and cook for 2-3 minutes.  Return the shrimp to the pan and toss to mix with the vegetables.  Saute until cooked through, firm to the touch and pink. Serve immediately over rice or orzo.

steps.step: Heat oil in a pan on medium-high.
Combine the spices and toss with the shrimp.
Add shrimp to the hot pan and cook about 45 seconds per side, or until opaque.
Add the scallions, garlic and ginger to the pan and cook for 2-3 minutes.  Return the shrimp to the pan and toss to mix with the vegetables.
Saute until cooked through, firm to the touch and pink.
Serve immediately over rice or orzo.
